result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher James DeSmith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher James DeSmith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher James DeSmith was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to report to Probation today July 16, 2015 by end of day.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Christopher James DeSmith appeared.  Court called at 1:38 p.m.  ADA Sortedahl recites the agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 with domestic abuse stricken.  Court enters a Guilty plea.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 with the domestic abuse stricken. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

W/S  and 1 year probation with conditions
- AODA with follow through and any recommended treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- It is hereby ordered in the above-captioned case, that the DE have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons,   B.A.D.  & K.J.D. dob 12/8/1998.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  
- Court costs of $243.00 & $200 for the DNA Surcharge 
- Payment plan granted and the DE to meet with payment clerk before leaving the courthouse
- DE to report to probation by end of the day 07/16/2015
- Bail is continued until the DE reports to probation and then it is vacated
- 20 days to appeal
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Christopher James DeSmith appeared.  Court called at 11:25 a.m.  ADA Sortedahl advises there is an agreement.  Bail is continued.  Set out for Plea/Sentencing.  Court adjourned at 11:26 a.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
to State's Discovery Demand. km

Pre-trial conference on June 29, 2015 at 11:00 am.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  K.J.D. dob 12/8/1998.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.


-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,   B.A.D. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
